text:
Hello everyone,

HubSpot displays in a contact level a timeline of events. If a contact viewed a website page, if a form was submitted, if a marketing email was clicked or open, etc.
Have any of you already used any endpoint of the API to try to fetch this data?

Thanks in advance

Hello everyone,
Is there any possibility to send customized data (as an array or object of elements) using an API to use it in an email that will be sent from a workflow?
Yes, store the data as a custom property. Needs to be in a format custom props support
Don't think it's open
Especially because there 20+ things that feed into that
Could you please explain more how ?
Look up writing custom properties. I don't do solution architect for others, but I can point you to the right docs
Yeah I already create customize property but how I can to set value of this property as array?
I think you'd need the field type to be a multi type
But that requires pre defined options.... So now I'm not sure

Hi guys!

We have an app using a client secret but would like to change it (rotation for security purposes). Is there any way we can do that on our own?

I contacted HubSpot "general" support but they directed me here
Not possible on your own afaik
Without making a new app, which isn't possible for app partners
HubSpot can rotate I believe, but chat is generally not helpful. Try out email support? Or your app partner
Thanks <@U05R67HM751>

I'm running an api call to get the deals associated with a company record. <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/companies/8470008274/associations/deals>
I get a 200 status code but no results. I can see inside the company record that there are deals. What's wrong?

I am trying to extract the data from all deals in the HubSpot, it extracts some information but not all of them,

Let me share with you my code,
import requests
import json
import urllib
import csv

# Set your variables
max_results = 3100
access_token = 'my_access_token'
limit = 100
deal_list = []
get_all_deals_url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/deals>"

# Set up the headers, including the OAuth 2.0 access token
headers = {
    'Authorization': f'Bearer {access_token}',
    'Content-Type': 'application/json'
}

# Set up the initial parameters
parameter_dict = {
    'limit': limit,
}


while True:
    # Make the API request
    response = requests.get(get_all_deals_url, headers=headers, params=parameter_dict)

    # Check if the request was successful
    if response.status_code == 200:
        # Parse the JSON response
        data = response.json()

        # Print the first deal data to inspect the structure
        if data['results']:
            print(json.dumps(data['results'][0], indent=4))
        deal_list.extend(data['results'])

        # Check if there are more pages
        if data.get('paging', {}).get('next', {}).get('after'):
            parameter_dict['after'] = data['paging']['next']['after']
        else:
            break
    else:
        # If the request was not successful, print the error
        print(f"Failed to retrieve deals: {response.status_code}")
        print(response.text)
        break

# Extract the necessary properties and write to a CSV
with open('deals.csv', 'w', newline='', encoding='utf-8') as output_file:
    writer = csv.writer(output_file)
    writer.writerow(['id', 'created_at', 'updated_at', 'deal_name', 'is_archived'])  # Header

    for deal in deal_list:
        deal_id = deal.get('id')
        created_at = deal.get('createdAt')
        updated_at = deal.get('updatedAt')
        deal_name = deal.get('properties', {}).get('dealname')
        is_archived = deal.get('archived')

        writer.writerow([deal_id, created_at, updated_at, deal_name, is_archived])

this is the example of an output,

{
    "id": ".........",
    "properties": {
        "amount": "4342",
        "closedate": "2019-10-22T06:00:00Z",
        "createdate": "2018-10-04T07:00:00Z",
        "dealname": "A Good Timeout - New Deal",
        "dealstage": "closedlost",
        "hs_lastmodifieddate": "2019-10-09T06:15:20.930Z",
        "hs_object_id": ".......",
        "pipeline": "default"
    },
    "createdAt": "2020-10-05T07:00:00Z",
    "updatedAt": "2023-09-06T06:15:20.930Z",
    "archived": false
}

but it does not return the source of a deal property named ‘billing effective date’.

Please help:)

you should <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/deals#:~:text=A%20comma%20separated%20list%20of%20the%20properties%20to%20be%20returned%20in%20the%20response|provide a list of properties you need as a query parameter.>
